Cleaned_Desc: This team is responsible for all or most Design and Development Engineering activities without major emphasis in any one functional area.Location: CN-ChangzhouDepartment: EngineeringJob ID: 4126Terex Overview:Terex Corporation is a $4.5 billion, publicly traded global manufacturer of lifting and material processing products and services. The company is passionate about producing equipment that improves the lives of people around the world. Terex operations are global, yet each office or factory is a close-knit community. Terex provides team members with a rewarding career and the opportunity to make an impact. The company values diversity and inclusion, safety, integrity, respect, servant leadership, courage and citizenship. It encourages continuous improvement and offers free courses available through Terex University. Women@Terex provides a supportive network for Terex women in their jobs and careers. It's an exciting time to be part of the expanding manufacturing sector. Terex is a place where you can work and grow. Come talk to us!Additional Information:It is the policy of the company to attract and retain the best qualified employees. We are committed to providing employment opportunities to the most qualified internal or external candidate based on work-related factors and without regard to non work-related factors including race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, disability, or veteran status as a special disabled veteran, Vietnam Era Veteran, or other qualifying veteran.The Company offers competitive salaries, advancement opportunities, and a full range of benefits, including paid vacation, 401(k), medical, dental, and vision.Terex Corporation is an Equal Opportunity Employer and Affirmative Action Employer M/F/D/V.

Cleaned_Desc: Requisition ID: 190745Work Area: Information TechnologyExpected Travel: 0 - 10%Career Status: StudentEmployment Type: InternCOMPANY DESCRIPTIONSAP started in 1972 as a team of five colleagues with a desire to do something new. Together, they changed enterprise software and reinvented how business was done. Today, as a market leader in enterprise application software, we remain true to our roots. That's why we engineer solutions to fuel innovation, foster equality and spread opportunity for our employees and customers across borders and cultures.SAP values the entrepreneurial spirit, fostering creativity and building lasting relationships with our employees. We know that a diverse and inclusive workforce keeps us competitive and provides opportunities for all. We believe that together we can transform industries, grow economics, lift up societies and sustain our environment. Because it's the best-run businesses that make the world run better and improve people's lives.SAP P&I - data transformation(DT) department provides migration and conversion solutions for SAP systems as well as the technical foundation for these solutions. An important part of this portfolio is the development and maintenance of several critical global product according to current market requirements. Now, we are looking for interns who join and strengthen the DT Beijing team to match the growing demand for several portfolios.Objectives:Design and develop SAP standard product on data migration based on the global strategyConduct analyses to scope and plan the solution approach in reorganization and migration projects.Maintain & support product based on the feedback from customer and consultant.Requirements:Have education background in Engineering, Computer Science, and/or Information System Management with a strong logical thinking abilityMaster at least one programing language (for example, Java, C/C++)Basic Knowledge on algorithms, data structures and object-oriented programmingGood English language skills including oral and writing skills.Ability to rapidly assimilate new technologies and be able to communicate effectively with various teams Presence of at least 4 days per week in office needed, preferably Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday, and ThursdayDesirablesTeam work spiritFast learner and strong customer centric attitudeHave high sense of responsibility and be detail orientedAgile, good at doing research, have the ability to solve problems aloneSelf-organized, can finish daily assignment without remindersBe patient, have strong interest in tasks which need many kinds of skills (interaction, logical thinking, solution design, customer support, Etc.).WHAT YOU GET FROM USSuccess is what you make it. At SAP, we help you make it your own. A career at SAP can open many doors for you. If you're searching for a company that's dedicated to your ideas and individual growth, recognizes you for your unique contributions, fills you with a strong sense of purpose, and provides a fun, flexible and inclusive work environment - apply now.SAP'S DIVERSITY COMMITMENTTo harness the power of innovation, SAP invests in the development of its diverse employees. We aspire to leverage the qualities and appreciate the unique competencies that each person brings to the company.SAP is committed to the principles of Equal Employment Opportunity and to providing reasonable accommodations to applicants with physical and/or mental disabilities. If you are in need of accommodation or special assistance to navigate our website or to complete your application, please send an e-mail with your request to Recruiting Operations Team (Americas: Careers.NorthAmerica@sap.com or Careers.LatinAmerica@sap.com, APJ: Careers.APJ@sap.com, EMEA: Careers@sap.com).Successful candidates might be required to undergo a background verification with an external vendor.Additional Locations:

Cleaned_Desc: Amazon Global Selling: The Marketplace or Selling on Amazon business exists in 10 countries and exceeds 40% of total Amazon unit sales and growing. Each year, tens of thousands of businesses join the marketplace adding millions of new products. Our vision is to offer customers Earths largest selection.The Tech team in China Global Selling operates very much like a startup it moves quickly and is constantly innovating. However, you have the full resources of Amazon at your disposal, allowing you to move at even greater speed. You will find that the team works in a very agile fashion, delivering new features every few weeks, adapting to customer needs as well as delivering against long-term goals.We are looking for an energetic, focused and skilled Senior Technical Program Manager to lead programs in Amazon Global Selling space. If you are a TPM with strong problem-solving skills, excellent communication skills, have an ability to influence business and technical leaders in a dynamic environment and the desire to be an individual contributor to high-impact space packed with challenging problems involving very complex systems and smart people, we want to talk with you.Responsibilities:* Effectively manage customer expectations and resolve conflicts that balance the needs of stakeholders, engineering, product management, operation team and drive improvements to Amazons bottom line.* In an agile environment, drive the entire product lifecycle: requirements definition through specification, design, coding, quality assurance, implementation, integration, launch, and production support with vendor experience in mind.* Synthesize requirements underlying feature requests, recommend alternative technical and business approaches, and lead engineering efforts to meet aggressive timelines. This will include writing detailed functional and test specification, coordinating efforts to scope, schedule, and deploy new features.* Understand service inter dependencies and drive towards technical solutions for multi-tiered systems* Clarify, prioritize and drive project commitments as well as establish and maintain clear chains of accountability* Address bottlenecks, provide escalation management, anticipate and make tradeoffs, balance the business needs versus technical constraints, and encourage risk-taking behavior to maximize business benefitBasic Qualifications* Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Computer Science or related technical field* Excellent written and verbal communication skills.* 5+ years of Technical Program Management experience in a related industry* Full life-cycle product development experience (from vision to production).* Problem-solving skills and the abilities to analyze quantitatively, scope technical requirements, and effectively prioritize program deliverables.* Track record for being detail-oriented with a demonstrated ability to self-motivate and follow-through on projectsPreferred Qualifications* The ability to comfortably and confidently present to all levels within the enterprise, and to work with both technical and non-technical individuals.* Experience in supply chain management and technologies* Experience in building partnerships with senior leaders across a variety of stakeholders across multiple business units.* Experience with agile or similar program management methodologies.* Experience working with remote teams and external partners.* Experience communicating with technical and non-technical stakeholders across multiple business units.

Cleaned_Desc: Skyscanner is a leading global travel search site and app, a place where people are inspired to plan and book direct from millions of travel options at the best prices. We employ over 1000 staff across ten offices globally, and, having reached market leader status, we were recently acquired by Chinese online travel company Ctrip in a deal valued at PS1.4bn. While we remain operationally independent, our acquisition by Ctrip allows us to take the business to the next level of accelerated global growth. It's a hugely exciting time for Skyscanner and the over 80m people who use us every month. We are unbiased and free, and our secret is in our unique proprietary technology that connects people directly to everything the travel industry has to offer.We're looking for a seasoned designer, leader and collaborator, with an amazing track in hands on directing, crafting and building world class products.What we are looking for as a Senior Design Manager:Strong product design background, with a clear idea of what great looks like across the relevant sub-disciplines (mental modelling, UI and interaction patterns, visual and motion, research, etc)A profound understanding of how great design drives key KPIs, such as conversion rates, as well overall business OKRsAble to point to success in complex, consumer-facing international businesses, having solved difficult product challenges across multiple platforms, services and use casesAn inspiring designer and manager, capable of raising and setting new standardsA proven track record in being highly effective at cross-functional stakeholder management - you will be 'The Glue'A strong and credible contributor to executive team decision-making, with an empowering and collaborative leadership styleHighly analytical, with a structured problem-solving approach, metrics/KPI driven, embedding a culture of data and fact-based decision-making across the design teamRazor-sharp focus, and the ability to 'cut through noise' to make sound and rapid commercial decisionsManagerial experience is requiredWhy Us?We are proud to have a working environment that sets our employees up for success, as well as all the usual perks you would expect from barista machines to massage chairs, to free food, holiday buying scheme as well as frequent townhalls with our CEO. What we really aim for is a place where people can thrive, be trusted to make impact and ultimately help us put our users first.What you will get in Shenzhen -Skyscanner can offer you large scale, complex problems where you can reach 80 million users whilst enjoying a high level of autonomy and influence and a flexible working environment where you can thrive.Join us now.

Cleaned_Desc: We are looking for a qualified Digital project manager to join our team. You will be responsible for the day-to-day management and smooth operation of various digital projects, including site launches, web applications and campaigns.For this position, we expect you to be methodical and have excellent time management skills. As a Digital project manager, you should also use your communication skills to collaborate effectively with various teams.Ultimately, you should be able to manage and deliver our projects' digital lifecycle within quality, time, and budget requirements.* Provide end-to-end project management from projects' inception to execution* Scope project requirements and prepare budget* Develop a detailed project plan and monitor progress* Collaborate with internal teams to design, develop and implement digital projects* Deliver projects on time ensuring quality standards are met* Develop support documentation including risk logs and requirement specifications* Communicate with the team and ensure all members are on board with delegated tasks* Highlight potential risks or malfunctions and act proactively to resolve issues* Evaluate and improve the delivery practices and techniques* Proven work experience of a digital project manager* Hands on experience with project management software, like MS Project* Understanding of SEO and Google Analytics* Have fundamental tech knowledge* Sharp attention to detail and a drive for perfection* Agile Communication and team management skills* Candidate with proficient English in both business and colloquial is preferred* 3-4 years' experience of project management

Cleaned_Desc: Hello. I'm going to read your mind.You are inquisitive, passionate and creative. You like to listen and love to ask why. You are a people person with an innate ability to talk to people in a way they understand. You'd prefer to be working in noisy team room than in an isolated cubicle. Facilitation comes naturally to you; you take the whiteboard over Word as the canvas you collaborate on. People say you make the complex simple. You effortlessly switch between big picture thinking and nit-picking detail. Pragmatism is your middle name, you work at speed, know what 'just' enough is and inspire with your can-do attitude. You are an Analyst who works for ThoughtWorks.Why do you do that?Well, you work on some pretty cool projects, building complex, enterprise-transforming business applications. You work with stakeholders across businesses to define what they need, and take responsibility for ensuring that applications fulfil the business requirements. You work alongside some of the most talented developers on the planet. You are part of diverse, high energy teams focused on full life-cycle development. You continually learn, mentor and grow. If this sounds like you and the sort of thing you'd like to do then we should talk. We are looking for brilliant and talented analysts to join ThoughtWorks China.Get the kind of challenge you loveFascinating clients on the one hand. Passionate software development teams looking for problems to solve on the other. You'll be the bridge between the two. It'll involve a lot of open and honest communication. It'll mean getting to know businesses inside out. Finding out what their software must achieve, how it will be used and then generating the ideas our developers draw on to create custom applications.Things happen when you're aroundAs a ThoughtWorks' Business Analyst, you will be responsible for understanding and communicating client requirements for successful project delivery.Analyze an organization and understand what makes it tickUnearth the root cause(s) of a client's pain points, validating the business opportunity or problem as an opportunity for a software solution or an organizational transformation solutionProvide expertise in the area of business case developmentFacilitate workshops and sessions that generate the content for solutions and gain buy in for solutionCreate and articulate the "big picture" of the solution to delivery and client teams to understand cross functional inter-dependencies and impactDefine key objectives and 'to-be" state, identify success factors, and comprehend constraints, challenges and risksEducate and championing the processes and practices of the Agile and Lean methodologyOrchestrate the collaboration between, Product Owner, Business Sponsors, SMEs, Testers and Development groups by removing roadblocks and facilitating communicationBecome a trusted and valued partner of the Product Owner, client's business stakeholders and client executivesBe an inspiration for innovation to the client.Drive thought-leadership within ThoughtWorks in the Business Analysis spaceCreate and support sales activitiesMaintaining strong expertise and knowledge of current and emerging technologies and productsWe take our hiring very seriously. We are looking for the following experience:A broad enterprise-wide view and understanding of business processes and drivers having significant work experience at a senior level within large - medium size business corporationsDemonstrated experience working successfully with teams to deliver softwareExperience prioritizing competing demands and obtaining buy-in from stakeholdersIdeally experienced working as part of a consulting organizationDemonstrated ability to manage and resolve conflict with stakeholdersExperience modeling business processes using a variety of tools and techniquesStrong facilitation experienceDemonstrated ability to understand and explain issues from both a technical and a business functional point of viewAn understanding of traditional development approaches, and the ability to compare and contrast benefits of eachcode: #LI-DNP

Cleaned_Desc: Would you like to own driving the revenue for Amazon Web Services (AWS) in Chinas largest and most innovative Aviation and Transportation companies? Would you like to be part of a cross-functional team focused on increasing technology adoption of cloud computing by engaging directly with C-level executives and influencers at all levels? Do you have the business background, technical depth, and communication skills needed to help further establish Amazon as the leader in Aviation and Transportation industry.Your responsibilities will include helping to define key enterprises, finding strategic partners, assembling cross-functional engagement teams, and driving business and technical relationships with customers to create significant new opportunity pipelines. You will enable the AWS enterprise sales teams to more effectively drive their day-to-day interactions with key prospects. You will work closely with AWS Solutions Architects and AWS Professional Services teams to develop and promote cloud best-practices. And you will work closely with the AWS product and services teams to help evolve AWS offerings for more rapid enterprise adoption while addressing issues, concerns, and requests from the field.The ideal candidate will possess a business background that enables them to drive an engagement and interact at the CXO/VP level of Aviation, transportation and affiliated companies, as well as having the technical depth to easily communicate the benefits of cloud computing to IT architects, application analysts, and enterprise security and compliance teams. The ideal candidate will also have a demonstrated ability to think strategically and long-term about the needs of global businesses, and be deeply familiar with complex, legacy IT environments including applications, middleware, storage, networks, information security, and operations. A keen sense of ownership, drive, and scrappiness is a must.Roles & Responsibilities:SS Serve as a key member of the Business Development team in helping to drive AWS marketing, sales, and technical strategies for the Aviation and transportation industrySS Define and size enterprise segments, identify key industry customers, and identify industry partners including ISVs and system integrators.SS Create strategic business development plans for identified opportunities and ensure these plans are in line with the AWS strategic direction.SS Develop industry-specific messaging and collateral materials that effectively communicate the AWS value proposition for enterprise cloud computing, including datacenter-to-cloud extension and migration.SS Execute the strategic business development plans while working closely with internal stakeholders including sales, marketing, & partner teams, solution architects, professional services and support teams, legal and contract teams, and the AWS service teams.SS Fill the business development pipeline by engaging with prospects, partners, and key customers.SS Understand the unique business & technical requirements of Aviation, transportation and affiliates customers and work closely with the internal development teams to guide the direction of our product offerings for our largest and most complex customers.SS Understand and exploit the use of Salesforce.com and other internal Amazon systems for campaign tracking and pipeline management.SS Prepare and present business reviews to the senior management team regarding progress and roadblocks to closing new enterprise customers.SS Manage complex enterprise contract negotiations, in cooperation with AWS legal and professional services teams.Basic QualificationsSS The right person will be business focused and will be capable of understanding the complexities of large Aviation, transportation and affiliates IT environments.SS Must have 7-10 years of business development and enterprise solution selling experience.SS Prior experience working in the Aviation/Airlines, or transportation IT industry is highly desired, either as a vendor or as an enterprise customerSS Some relevant technical knowledge is helpful, such as: database systems, core distributed computing concepts, fundamentals of cloud computing and virtualization, storage systems, etc. with ability to go deep enough on technical aspects to differentiate between varied data storage services.SS Strong verbal and written communications skills are a must, as well as leadership skills.SS Must have a demonstrated ability to work effectively across internal and external organizations, including strategic partners and ISVs.Preferred QualificationsSS Experience working within the technology industry is highly desiredSS Experience in working with customers who are in digital transformation of Aviation and transportation IndustriesSS MBA or equivalent background helpful#AWSCHINA#AWSCNBD#AWSGCR

Create strategic business development plans for identified opportunities and ensure these plans are in line with the AWS strategic direction.SS Develop industry-specific messaging and collateral materials that effectively communicate the AWS value proposition for enterprise cloud computing, including datacenter-to-cloud extension and migration.SS Execute the strategic business development plans while working closely with internal stakeholders including sales, marketing, & partner teams, solution architects, professional services and support teams, legal and contract teams, and the AWS service teams.SS Fill the business development pipeline by engaging with prospects, partners, and key customers.SS Understand the unique business & technical requirements of Aviation, transportation and affiliates customers and work closely with the internal development teams to guide the direction of our product offerings for our largest and most complex customers.SS Understand and exploit the use of Salesforce.com and other internal Amazon systems for campaign tracking and pipeline management.SS Prepare and present business reviews to the senior management team regarding progress and roadblocks to closing new enterprise customers.SS Manage complex enterprise contract negotiations, in cooperation with AWS legal and professional services teams.Basic QualificationsSS The right person will be business focused and will be capable of understanding the complexities of large Aviation, transportation and affiliates IT environments.SS Must have 7-10 years of business development and enterprise solution selling experience.SS Prior experience working in the Aviation/Airlines, or transportation IT industry is highly desired, either as a vendor or as an enterprise customerSS Some relevant technical knowledge is helpful, such as: database systems, core distributed computing concepts, fundamentals of cloud computing and virtualization, storage systems, etc. with ability to go deep enough on technical aspects to differentiate between varied data storage services.SS Strong verbal and written communications skills are a must, as well as leadership skills.SS Must have a demonstrated ability to work effectively across internal and external organizations, including strategic partners and ISVs.Preferred QualificationsSS Experience working within the technology industry is highly desiredSS Experience in working with customers who are in digital transformation of Aviation and transportation IndustriesSS MBA or equivalent background helpful#AWSCHINA#AWSCNBD#AWSGCR

Cleaned_Desc: In this role, you will be working in one of the world's largest and most complex data warehouse environments, and having the following job tasks and responsibilities:* Get familiar with multiple systems and data warehouses owned by various Amazon business teams and supporting functions; be able to extract required data from those databases in a short frame of time to meet internal and external audit requirements.* Translate various tax requests into data queries, locate the related data in the most appropriate database(s), and generate reports accordingly in a form that is easy to follow/understand.* Perform data-mining and analysis using tools including Tax Data Warehouse, Oracle BI Analytics, MS Excel, and other related financial and tax systems to generate reports, identify trends and support with forecasts.* Perform regular data audits on tax-related systems to ensure they are correct and up to date.* Use existing data sources to monitor trends and communicate findings within a matrixed environment, able to create forecasting spreadsheets to support tax filings and planning projects.* Work with tax team members to build reporting and other technical solutions that support automation and streamlining of Tax processes.Basic Qualifications* Bachelor's degree.* 3+ years of professional experience in data analytics, business analysis, marketing insight or consulting position.* Able to communicate complex messages and outputs from their analysis, and the ability to train others in technical/analysis skills.* Ability to create tools and models to interpret and analyze large data sets and communicate results to leaders* Ability to deal with ambiguity and competing objectives in a fast paced environment.Preferred Qualifications* Bachelor's degree in Business, Economics, Statistics, Engineering or a related field.* Strong analytical and quantitative skills and a track record for planning, doing and auditing work.* Advanced working knowledge of data retrieving and processing using data warehouse, Excel, etc.* Proven problem solving skills, attention to detail, and exceptional organizational skills.* Detail driven with emphasis on accuracy, coupled with the ability to see the broader picture.* Strong sense of accountability and sound personal judgment with the capacity to handle confidential information and escalate issues effectively.

Cleaned_Desc: Amazon Prime Video is seeking a Software Development Engineer (SDE) to join the Partner Integration Team and work with the A-list of home entertainment manufacturers to bring Amazon Video (AV) to the latest and greatest home entertainment devices. If you like getting your hands dirty, working with cutting-edge entertainment hardware, and shipping product, then this is the place to be. The team has already launched Prime Video on a range of living room devices from Sony, Samsung, LG and Hisense amongst others. As consumer equipment manufacturers continue to innovate, so we will work with them to integrate, innovate and deliver a fantastic Prime Video experience for our customers.Job DescriptionAs a Software Development Engineer in the Prime Video Partner Engineering Team, you will be responsible for working directly with the engineering teams of top home entertainment vendors from around the world to bring Prime Video to their range of TVs, set-top boxes, and other living room devices. This role requires very strong troubleshooting and debugging skills in non-traditional environments. You must enjoy getting yours hands dirty and working through complex software integration issues.The Software Development Engineer will be part of a software development team integrating & testing client applications for Prime Video on living room devices. They will work to deliver a superlative and immersive experience to Amazon Video customers on a growing range of devices. The SDE will innovate, automate and trouble-shoot device integrations.A successful candidate will have an established background in developing customer-facing experiences, a strong technical ability, excellent organizational skills, great communication skills, a motivation to achieve results in a fast-paced environment, high creativity, great analytical reasoning skills, and, of course, a passion for TV, live sports, and/or film.Basic Qualifications* Degree in Computer Science or related* Production-level experience with JavaScript frameworks* Strong written and verbal communication skills* Experience with owning end-to-end software life-cycle* Comfortable with a rapidly changing environment* Experience of product development in consumer-focused companies* Experience developing in at least one of Java, C or Perl* Professional proficiency in Mandarin Chinese and English* Ability to travel to throughout Asia and to the UKPreferred Qualifications* Experience with embedded systems will be valuable* Experience with object-oriented design* Experience with data structures* Experience with algorithm design, problem solving, and complexity analysis* Working proficiency in Korean or Japanese

Cleaned_Desc: Skyscanner is a leading global travel search site and app, a place where people are inspired to plan and book direct from millions of travel options at the best prices. We employ over 1000 staff across eleven offices globally, and, having reached market leader status, we were recently acquired by Chinese online travel company Ctrip in a deal valued at PS1.4bn. While we remain operationally independent, our acquisition by Ctrip allows us to take the business to the next level of accelerated global growth. It's a hugely exciting time for Skyscanner and the over 80m people who use us every month. We are unbiased and free; our secret is in our unique proprietary technology that connects people directly to everything the travel industry has to offer.We're seeking senior mobile engineers to join us in our Shenzhen office and be part of our highly distributed global team. We have a mantra for scaling and innovation and as such we are recruiting across several of our teams and this role has arisen due to that continued growth.We're building some kickass tooling, with deploy pipelines out of the box to get moving quickly and exploring server side/hybrid rendering strategies for our iOS and Android apps as well as looking at ReactNative.If you enjoy a range of technical challenges across app development where we are building and shipping features from the ground up, then this could be the role for you. Product teams working on mobile apps also do data analysis, design systems and release services which all adds up to a mobile experience.Skyscanner operates in a Tribes and Squads model and we have created an engineering culture where there is a high level of trust, autonomy and transparency. Our engineers work in autonomous teams (squads), they create their own backlog, they ship code whenever they want and don't have dependencies in order to deliver to their users. Our engine uses global scale services, big data and machine learning to capture, normalise and make sense of real time information from our thousands of partners.What you can expect as a senior mobile engineerA supportive, trusting and transparent working environmentA place to look at things differently and challenge and offer solutionsOverall responsibility of multiple key product feature components within your areaYou will define and implement services that make up a complex sub system within the scope of your areaCollaboration across all relevant product engineering development lifecyclesAn opportunity to influence the engineers around youWhat we are looking forPrevious job experience as a software engineer ideally within an internet economy businessMetrics driven approach to decision making, prioritisation and continuous deploymentProven competencies in developing, releasing and maintaining native appsUse of agile/lean methodologies for continuous delivery and improvementComfortable balancing trade offs between technical, analytical and product needsStrong customer focus and appreciation of what makes good product, UX and designYou make others better proactively through code reviews, documentation, technical guidance and mentoringYou will work with or lead your team to break down solutions into small tasks to be completed autonomouslyWe don't expect you to be an expert in all of these technologies but would anticipate experience with some, combined with a curiosity for others- Objective-C, Java, Swift, Fastlane, Gradle, Microservices, Docker, Drone, AWS, SQL, Python, ElasticsearchIt would be useful to have experience in large scale systems deployed to AWSWhat else can we offer you......We also provide for your health with medical insurance, health screening options, gym membership, headspace subscription and an employee assistance programme to support you and your loved ones. Then it gets really interesting, and you can buy more holiday, donate to a good cause, take part in 2 hackdays per year, and 1 charity day, work from your home country for up to 3 weeks, spend up to 30 days working from another of our offices globally. You also have the option to take part in our extended annual leave which is an additional 3 weeks' break (unpaid) after 3 years' service or take 5 weeks' break (paid) after 5 years' service.Join us now.For more details on Engineering at Skyscanner you can check our Engineering Blog and follow Skyscanner Engineering on Twitter

header.jobTitle: MXA CTE Principal Engineer, Test Engineering Excellence
Cleaned_Desc: Recruiter: Yang LuReq. ID: 140131Job DescriptionAs a MXA CTE Principal Engineer, Test Engineering Excellence, you will assist with improving individual capability by conducting performance appraisals with team members to create goals and development plans. You will monitor performance metrics to identify and implement continual improvement opportunities. You will be responsible for driving quality improvement, production optimization and enabling the Equipment development team. This encompasses activities such as new equipment solution introductions, productivity improvements, and key equipment utilization improvement thru automation or equipment process optimization to exceed best in class. Other responsibilities include ensuring organizational compliance to company policies and regulations, as well as to departmental procedures, and providing organizational leadership for building and implementing department strategies, processes, and policy through active participation in functional teams and projects, as well as mentoring other functional leaders through collaboration and the development of sustainable solutions.ResponsibilitiesArea/Section managementEnsure a Safe, Compliant, and Ethical Work EnvironmentDrive quality improvement for Functional Area OperationsDrive for efficiency in all work processesIdentify manage and monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) for the sectionDrive process simplification projects to maximize efficiency and reduce costsPromote and model the use of systematic thinking processesCoordinate with Central Teams to support global initiative, Copy Smart initiative and others as neededIncorporate change management methodologiesPrioritize and approve projects to align with MXA's areas of focusManage, measure and monitor projects to ensure deliverables and time frames are met include provide resource and remove barriersStrategic CommunicationCommunicate section goals and areas of focus within your sphere of influenceProvide section updates to review current status and future goals and objectivesMaintain ongoing dialogue with global counterpartsCommunicate customer expectations to the organizationManage the people side of changePerformance ManagementCreate an environment of motivation to foster team members' engagement to the fullest of their potentialDevelop a succession management strategy and periodically conduct talent reviews within sectionAdvocate a performance management culture, monitoring the use of the performance management system within the sectionDrive the deployment of Micron core values within the organizationMonitor and manage the internal climate within the organizationFoster an environment where "winning as a team" is a way of lifeDevelop and promote technical expertise in the group by supporting attendance to conferences and seminarsStrategic LeadershipRemain current on business and industry knowledge; current and possible future polices, practices and trendsIdentify, develop, and implement organizational initiatives that drive benchmark cultureProvide ideas and recommendations to site leadership on department initiativesKnow the competition; be aware of how strategies and tactics work in the market placeCreate competitive and innovative strategies and plansFoster an environment where innovative thinking and intelligent risk taking is promotedActively collaborate with global partners to reach aligned decisionsBe visible in problem solving efforts; provide guidance for effective and timely resolutionIdentify, understand and mitigate risk before making critical decisionsEnvironmental, Health, Safety and SecurityExercise due diligence to prevent and detect safety and environmental hazards and violationsDemonstrate support for EHS programs to reinforce a positive culture for EHS activitiesDemonstrate support for the execution of the EHS management systems throughout the organizationEnsure required EHS training is completedProvide team members the resources necessary to fulfill their EHS responsibilitiesClearly communicate expectations and enforce safety and environmental policiesPromptly implement preventative and corrective actions when gaps in expectations are identifiedCommunicate problems or concerns to the appropriate individual immediatelyEducationA BS or above in an Engineering discipline or a combination of related experience and education is required.Qualifications10 years + experience in semiconductor test house, equipment engineering/development/solution providing. The ability to manage multiple tasks concurrently and see them to completion based on a given timelineDemonstrated success in a managerial positionExcellent communication skills both in Chinese and English.Self-motivated and enthusiasticGood team player and foster collaboration among the team members.Required Knowledges, Skills and abilityKnowledge of technical engineering design, development, and standardsKnowledge of mechanical/ electrical/ software control technologyKnowledge of new equipment introduction, qualification, buyoff, and continues performance improvementGood knowledge on equipment maintenance with TPM,VSM,6S programsBasic skills in AutoCAD, and Microsoft office toolsFamiliar with Quality system and demonstrated success in leading changesInnovative and resourceful person who knows from where and how to obtain potential supplier information is a plusWe recruit, hire, train, promote, discipline and provide other conditions of employment without regard to a person's race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, pregnancy, veteran's status, or other classifications protected under law. This includes providing reasonable accommodation for team members' disabilities or religious beliefs and practices.Each manager, supervisor and team member is responsible for carrying out this policy. The EEO Administrator in Human Resources is responsible for administration of this policy. The administrator will monitor compliance and is available to answer any questions on EEO matters.To request assistance with the application process, please contact Micron's Human Resources Department at 1-800-336-8918 (or 208-368-4748).Keywords: Xi'an || Shaanxi (CN-61) || China (CN) || Backend Manufacturing || Experienced || Regular || Engineering || #LI-YL2 ||

Cleaned_Desc: Healthcare IndustryYou will have the opportunity to collaborate with customers, sales, solutions architecture, software development and service teams to deliver technical solutions that solve some of the most complex and challenging technology problems of today. You will work with customer and internal stakeholders to scope work, set business goals, identify appropriate resources, track and report on progress and develop schedules. You will be a single point of contact to your enterprise level customer and internal stakeholders on the progress of all the activities, deliverables and QBRs to C-level related to your customer. You will also need to assess risks, anticipate bottlenecks, provide critical issue management, balance trade-offs, and encourage risk-tasking to maximize business value. You will be an AWS evangelist and influence your customers to allocate the appropriate resources to achieve their goals.At AWS we value critical thinking, self-motivation, and the ability to deal with ambiguity. You should bring a cool head, strong technical background, be detail oriented, have excellent problem solving abilities, and be an exemplary communicator. Your technical expertise and operational excellence will influence the whole account teams decisions and help us drive secure and robust customer solutions. We love people who innovate, use data to make decisions, and can express themselves thoughtfully. We want you to be passionate about delivering a great customer experience, and love contributing to a team goal.Basic Qualifications* 10+ years leading and project managing complex, large scale, IT/technical/engineering programs* 7~8+ years in a client facing role* Bachelor's degree in Science, Technology, Engineering, Math or equivalent experience (Computer Science preferred)* Superior written and verbal communication skills* Demonstrated ability to effectively deliver information at the C-suite/VP level* Experience working with current web technologies (especially Cloud)* Self-motivated problem solver; able to thrive in a dynamic and customer-focused environment* Strong organizational and troubleshooting skills with precise attention to detail* Demonstrated ability to maintain composure in stressful situations, responds to customer needs quickly and effectively, adapts to change* Highly analytical, technically proficient, and able to learn new tools and software quickly* Strong listening skills; demonstrated ability to ask effective questionsPreferred Qualifications* Direct experience implementing AWS/cloud services* Deep understanding of software development/engineering lifecycle from conception to delivery* Demonstrated leadership through influence* Prior experience working with or managing large technical programs, particularly at high growth startups or Fortune 500 companies* Prior experience working in a Technology sales organization#AWSCHINA#AWSCNSALES#AWSGCR

Cleaned_Desc: NovAtel Inc. (A Hexagon Positioning Intelligence Company) is looking for a tech-savvy and personable Application Engineer to help us drive our business forward by supporting some of the biggest names in the industry. In this exciting hands-on position, you will utilize your GNSS+INS expertise to ensure our customers' success. Through the support of our Sales and Business Development teams, you will help to increase awareness of NovAtel's revolutionary technologies, consult on positioning solutions for many exciting applications, and provide field and professional services to NovAtel's worldwide customer base.While part of a growing Global Application Engineering team, this position will have a strong focus on supporting NovAtel's (A Hexagon Positioning Intelligence Company) customers in China and will report into Hexagon PI's head office located in Calgary, Alberta, Canada. The team collaborates closely with Customers, Sales, Product Management, Project Management and Marketing to help ensure the cohesive and comprehensive delivery of products and materials. Our customers rely on NovAtel's industry leading precision GNSS and INS technology when building their own solutions.This position based in Beijing or Shanghai, China, may be a great fit if you have a passion for emerging technology, and desire to use your Geomatics or related engineering skills to solve real-world challenges and shape the future of the GNSS Industry.As our Application Engineer, you would be responsible for:Providing front line product and application support on NovAtel Hardware, Software, and related GNSS & INS topics to internal and external customersProviding customer training, demonstrations, technical assistance, and technical sales support with some of the biggest names in the industryCollaborate with other departments regarding technical mattersWorking closely with Sales / Business Development in accordance to the market needs and agreed prioritiesFormulating and implementing procedures and plans for resolving problemsPerforming software testing, verification, bug reports, and field trial coordinationReviewing technical documentation materials and manualsGenerating application notes for frequently asked questions and contributing to our internal and external knowledge baseMust-Have:  Degree in Geomatics, Electrical Engineering or related field2+ years of related industry experienceExceptional interpersonal skills and ability to get on with othersEnglish fluency with excellent verbal and written skillsMandarin fluencyAbility and willingness to travel internationally, including trips to Canada to collaborate with the larger Application Engineering teamKey Success Factors: High attention to detail and exceedingly organizedStrong multitasker with keen ability to prioritizeSelf-motivated team player with proven problem-solving skillsOutgoing and energetic with exceptional people skillsWork well in a collaborative environmentNice-to-Have:Experience working directly with customers, preferably in the delivery of support or servicesExperience in GNSS and INS systems installation and/or troubleshooting

Cleaned_Desc:
Job DescriptionWith the experience to be the FP&A analyst in finance group, you will have the opportunity to start your career in the Top 500 high-tech company. You will have the chance to learn the most advance semiconductor business acumen in the world and be part of the finance team to engage in key financial analysis to support business running. The R&R include budget forecast, Close, cost analysis and controls etc.QualificationsPrefer to the candidates who major in Finance, Business or Accounting. Related working experience will be a plus.Good English communication skill on oral English and writing.Good communication, logic thinking and critical thinking.Knowledge in Microsoft office applications, such as PowerPoint, Excel, Power BI will be a plus.Inside this Business GroupAs members of the Finance team, employees act as full partners in making and supporting business decisions that are aimed at maximizing shareholder value. Intel Finance has a strong focus on facilitating change and improvement both within finance and in the operations supported.

Position of TrustThis role is a Position of Trust. Should you accept this position, you must consent to and pass an extended Background Investigation, which includes (subject to country law), extended education, SEC sanctions, and additional criminal and civil checks. For internals, this investigation may or may not be completed prior to starting the position. For additional questions, please contact your Recruiter....

header.jobTitle: Developer Relations Analyst, Lion Studios, Shanghai
Cleaned_Desc: At AppLovin, we build technology that helps make mobile games successful and enables developers to bring their games to more people around the world. Since we launched in 2012, our technology platform has been instrumental in fueling the explosive growth of many mobile games, including those developed by our own studio and by our studio partners. We've built an amazing team of talented people who are committed to helping the mobile games industry thrive. Lion Studios by AppLovin works with mobile game developers to publish, market, and grow their businesses. AppLovin is headquartered in Palo Alto with offices in San Francisco, Dublin, Beijing, Tokyo, Seoul, Toronto, Herzliya and Berlin. Learn more at applovin.com.AppLovin is one of Inc.'s Best Workplaces and a recipient of the 2019 Glassdoor Top CEO employee's choice award. The San Francisco Business Times' awarded AppLovin one of the Bay Area's Best Places to Work and the Workplace Wellness Award, which recognizes businesses that are leaders in improving worker well-being.We are looking for a Developer Relations Analyst to join our Lion Studios team in Shanghai, China, to help us build innovative and engaging mobile games that gamers don't just play, but love. Our team is motivated by releasing games that "wow" players, push the boundaries of what's possible, and impact millions of users across the globe.Lion Studios is a dynamic studio that delivers captivating mobile app experiences to over a billion users around the world. Founded in 2018, Lion Studios has already helped drive twelve #1 overall free apps for iOS/Android and over ten which ranked in the top 10 overall. These titles include smash hit puzzle games Mr. Bullet, Happy Glass, Puzzle Fuzzle, and Love Balls, hyper-casual games I Peel Good and The Real Juggle, and idle hits Hooked Inc and Cash, Inc. Headquartered in San Francisco, California, Lion Studios is focused on helping app developers build profitable app businesses, offering the industry experience and creative services teams they need to reach their goals faster.Responsibilities:Own and build strong relationships with key contactsWork closely with key contacts to generate product feedback and drive constant improvementUnderstand and generate analyses of the competitive mobile gaming space, it's users, and use metrics to determine the right set of features to drive an engaged experience in Lion StudiosDefine and analyze metrics that inform the success of our mobile game titlesUnderstand Lion Studios' strategic and competitive position and deliver accordinglyMaximize efficiency in a constantly evolving environment where the process is flexible and creative solutions are the normNetwork at events and meet-ups within the mobile gaming / application space to build business relationships and partnershipsBasic Qualifications:Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Business, Finance or related fieldProven track record in relationship management and supporting the development of successful mobile games or appsStrong communication skills with the ability to understand technical subjects and emerging technologies and their relevance to the marketplaceOutstanding interpersonal skills with a proactive mindsetStrong understanding of the most recent trends around mobile gamesAble to work flexible hours to engage with our worldwide organization and customer baseAbility to work independently and deliver strong results in a fast paced environment, as well as in a collaborative team settingPluses:Passionate about gaming and game productionExperience building mobile games with a demonstrated ability to drive planning, development and launchPerks:Competitive SalaryStock OptionsFree medical insuranceFree lunchesCommuting benefitsGym membership benefitsFun company parties and eventsAutonomy to make decisions in a rapidly growing companyInterested? Send us your resume and let's talk!#LI-NE1

Cleaned_Desc: IDC is the premier global provider of market intelligence, advisory services, and events for the information technology, telecommunications, and consumer technology markets. IDC helps IT professionals, business executives, and the investment community make fact-based decisions on technology purchases and business strategy. More than 1,100 IDC analysts provide global, regional, and local expertise on technology and industry opportunities and trends in over 110 countries worldwide. For 50 years IDC has provided strategic insights to help our clients achieve their key business objectives. IDC's Insights businesses provide industry-focused advice for IT buyers in the Financial, Government, Health, Retail, Manufacturing and Energy verticals. IDC is a subsidiary of IDG, the world's leading technology media, research, and events company. You can learn more about IDC by visiting www.idc.com. To carry out business development and research work on the China PC sale out Device Tracker and to support the growth of IDC's research in China. The role will include responsibility in developing relationship with vendors to drive monthly pc and others device conversation and performing quantitative and qualitative market analysis, writing reports, and interaction with vendors and channel partners to collect market data. Knowledge of ICT markets is a benefitMust have intermediate Excel skills (MUST GIVE A TEST TO ESTABLISH THIS)Must have strong writing skills in English (MUST GIVE A TEST TO ESTABLISH THIS)Must be able to provide intelligent analysis (MUST GIVE A TEST TO ESTABLISH THIS)Must have strong problem-solving skills (MUST GIVE A TEST TO ESTABLISH THIS)Must have strong desk research skills (MUST GIVE A TEST TO ESTABLISH THIS)Preferably intermediate Word skills (not compulsory) (MUST GIVE A TEST TO ESTABLISH THIS)Preferably intermediate PowerPoint skills (not compulsory)Preferably intermediate presentation skills (not compulsory)Strong communication skills (able to demonstrate persuasiveness and candour)PersistentFast learnerMeticulous / detail-orientedResourcefulAdaptable (demonstrates willingness to adapt to changes in responsibilities or conditions)Willing to work hard (demonstrates desire to exceed expectations)Demonstrates initiative / Able to perform duties with minimal supervisionLeadership ability

Cleaned_Desc: Amazon China is seeking an entrepreneurial Manager, based in Shanghai, China, to join a global Special Project team with customer experience strategy projects. The scope of this innovative project in China will inform and impact larger company strategic decisions and its vision for the future is truly exciting.The ideal candidate will be a highly entrepreneurial Manager with a passion for business development, brand and product management, developing business strategies and who is not afraid to build a project from the ground up.Special Projects leads a global project based in 6 countries across the world and this role contributes to the development of the project in China with plenty of growth and scope ahead. The role involves establishing business operations in China; developing a business plan, budgets and putting in place marketing strategies. The ideal candidate must be able to think big and small interchangeably as the project has big goals but requires a strong ability to invent and simplify and deliver plans frugally. The role involves developing and administering the full cycle of innovation from ideation to execution, working on improving customer experience, pricing strategies as well as brands and working on supply chain.The role will be a good fit if you:Are entrepreneurial and like working with ambiguityHave strong ownership and love creating better Customer experienceAre creative with finding solutions and love solving problemsKey Job ResponsibilitiesOwning key aspects of the project in China including running day-to-day operation, setting up items and delivering the project roadmapSupport the growth of the global project across multiple innovations from a strategic and operational viewpointContinuously innovate and improve processes, driving down costsEvaluate and measure performance and report on key insightsCollaborate with internal business partners to ensure project output is leveraged to its full extentNavigate internal teams and work with diverse cross-functional groups, including business teams, finance, sales, technology, support, fulfillment, and supply chainBasic Qualifications* Bachelor's degree and 5 years professional experience* Ability to communicate technical concepts to a non-technical audience (verbal and written) in Mandarin and EnglishPreferred Qualifications* Masters Degree or MBA* Experienced Product Manager or Program Manager* Experience with entrepreneurship or a keen interest in developing businesses* Experience with negotiation and dealing with suppliers* Experience in digital marketing and/or brand development and management* Experience with manufacturing, sourcing* Experience with retail, retail operations* Experienced project manager who can lead and operate multiple project streams confidently* Strong project management or management consulting experience* Thrives in a fast-changing environment and ambiguous situations* A passion for customer experience* Ability to handle changing priorities and use good judgment when working with ambiguity* Strong sense of urgency and personal commitment* Able to work with business partners in understanding the business requirements and implementing solutions* Able to leverage data to drive decision making

header.jobTitle: Brand Management Function - PG Venture Brand Manager
Cleaned_Desc: Are you looking to take your career to the next level?We are looking for great talent who has strong entrepreneur mind-set with China e-commerce experience including X-border, who is creative and very externally focused to join us in Guangzhou as PG Venture Brand Manager.PG Venture China Brand managers role is three folds.One is to test and prove the potential of innovation in China market.Two if the proposition of innovation is proven, incubate/build it until this is handed over to business unit.Three is to explore and discover the innovation opportunity in China and lead the development from the scratch like a start-up does with the supports from multi-function team and 3rd party agency. Key deliverablesLead holistic execution of new innovation launch plan through e-commerce platform including X-border.Once the proposition is proven, incubate the business in China until we hand over to Business Unit.Explore and discover the innovation opportunity in China and lead the development of innovation from the scratch with the help from multi-function team and 3rd party agency.Provide competitive category landscape and consumer insight to project team in Cincinnati. Strong entrepreneurshipExperience in China e-commerce specifically managing X-border business.Experience launching very small sized brand and grow from Zero to 1.Native in Mandarin and fluent in EnglishStrong communication and problem solving skillRoll-up sleeve and hands on mind-setPlease kindly input your name in both Chinese characters and Pinyin when you fill in the form. Thank you!!About usOur P&G Greater China region consists of three markets Chinese Mainland, Hong Kong SAR and Taiwan. Today, it is one of the largest consumer products companies in the region, serving over a billion Chinese consumers with more than 25 brands across 10 categories. These include Rejoice, Pantene, Head & Shoulders, Vidal Sassoon, Olay, SK-II, Safeguard, Ariel, Tide, Febreze, Gillette, Venues, Braun, Oral-B, Crest, Pampers, Whisper, Tampax and Vicks. Several other global brands are also available to Chinese consumers via the P&G International Flagship Store on T-Mall.P&G Greater China is headquartered in Guangzhou, Guangdong, with operations across the region, including offices in Hong Kong, Taipei, Shanghai, Beijing, Chengdu, one R&D center in Beijing, one digital innovation center in Guangzhou, eight manufacturing plants and eleven distribution centers. These locations combined employ more than 8000 people. We are recognized as the Huangpu School of the business communities and seen as one of the best companies in talent development. For the past years, we have been considered as the Most Attractive Employer in our industry by Universum.All of our hiring in China will follow the China Government Employment Regulation, foreign candidate applying for mainland China's position should comply with local laws and regulations on foreigner employment management, please kindly click here tounderstand more of this regulation.

Cleaned_Desc: At Amazon we continually look for opportunities to invent on behalf of our customers helping them to find and discover virtually anything they want to buy online. To this end we are building a range of advertising products that enhance customer experience and are integrated with our core e-commerce platform. We have developed products that demonstrates Amazons strength as a world class e-commerce platform and have integrated advertising into the shopping experience from first discovery to purchase.The future of our business is compelling and we are focused on building a robust, innovative business enabling advertisers of all sizes. Our products range from e-commerce ads that integrate the power of familiar shopping features to visually stunning Kindle screensavers. We can reach customers on Amazon properties, both web and mobile, and across our ad platforms.A strategically important part of our charter is to build a portfolio of self-service, cost per click advertising programs to enable all advertisers to engage with customers in relevant ways. Examples of products already in the market are Sponsored Products, Sponsored Brands and Stores. We are building a team who owns advertiser adoption and retention for Self-Service Performance Advertising (SSPA) programs. This team will have functional expertise in marketing, product, market analysis, advertiser academy and program management. Working directly with advertisers we will develop strong feedback mechanisms to inform and influence the product road-map.As a Training Manager for SA team, you will help define your role working to identify controllable inputs which enable product teams to drive revenue and deliver an amazing customer experience. You will work closely with China-based advertisers who want to advertise their products on Amazon global websites and have direct responsibility for helping them optimize their advertising campaigns. Your day to day activities will change constantly as our business grows and you can expect to propose to create and establish programs that impact thousands of advertisers and build business cases to drive feature development with product and engineering teams. You can expect to work closely with the marketing and product teams on advertiser communication plans related to new feature launches and program changes. This is a critical role and your efforts will drive advertiser commitment, revenue growth and product improvements.Responsibilities* Create effective training contents based on deep understanding of advertisers insights and needs in each marketplaces(NA, EU and JP)*Partner with sales teams, subject matter experts (SMEs), and other key stakeholders to identify target audience training needs and deliver learning modules against required training timelines* Work in a team of site trainers and coordinate, plan, deliver and facilitate workflow training modules including: new hire training, onboarding and continuing education sessions, product launch training sessions, seller connection sessions for SSPA, and other SSPA-specific training as needed.* Manage comprehensive program plans for long term programs and drive execution of programs according to the plans.* Interface with advertisers at all levels to collect VOCs, requirements and feedback, define objectives & deliver results.* Present and lead conversations about projects, issues, solutions, and strategy to stakeholders and subject matter experts.* Host and/or facilitate sessions to deeply understand specific learning objectives, skills, and behaviors globally and across specific markets, verticals and teams.* Deploy metrics to track progress against program metrics and report on weekly, monthly, quarterly, and yearly progress.Basic QualificationsBASIC QUALIFICATIONS* Undergraduate and/or Masters degree required or equivalent experience* Minimum of 4 years professional sales, training or marketing related experience.* Ability to work in fast-paced environment and resourceful in achieving success in the face of ambiguity* Skilled in and can demonstrate experience with planning, creating, implementing, delivering online and offline marketing training programs* Experience with one-to-many and one-to-one communication skills in both classroom and tutorial settings* Experience collaborating with global stakeholders, SMEs, front-line managers and front-line employees* Attention to detail; prioritize multiple tasks simultaneously without sacrificing the ability to dive deep* Written and verbal fluency in English and Chinese, as required to work with English and Chinese language* Competent user level of Microsoft Office tools (Word, Excel and PowerPoint)* Comfort with travel (max 1-2 days/week )Preferred QualificationsPREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS* Proven ability to multitask and prioritize critical tasks with a high attention to detail* Superior written and verbal communication skills and ability to succinctly summarize key findings* Strong meeting management and negotiating skills* Digital advertising and Pay-Per-Click advertising experience is a plus

header.jobTitle: Associate Content Analyst-Fund-replace of Qin Yang
Cleaned_Desc: Job DescriptionJob DescriptionThe CompanyThomson Reuters employees take pride in providing our customers around the world with information that is timely, accurate, unbiased and trusted. We have a profound respect for the professions and customers we serve and define our success in terms of their success. Our work environment is dynamic, innovative and entrepreneurial. We have a result-oriented culture that demands excellence, agility, and the desire to move quickly and precisely to seize opportunities. Our environment is both challenging and supportive - we give employees the opportunity to develop their skills and do their best work.Thomson Reuters values diversity of culture and thought and seeks talented, qualified employees in all its operations around the world regardless of race, gender, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, disability, age or any other protected classification under country or local law.Thomson Reuters is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer.ResponsibilitiesProvide clients with Financial Data relating to companies for APAC Markets, mainly for Korean marketMaintain databases in a timely and accurate mannerUse appropriate language skills to understand and source financial informationUse technical and financial knowledge to add value to current data offeringKeep abreast of daily market activity to ensure Thomson Reuters information is timely and completeSeek efficiencies in work practices to achieve automationProvide feedback on new database/application releasesEnsure timely and complete resolution of queries from internal and external clientsBuild up knowledge of financial regulations and market practicesLiaise directly with internal and external clientsDocument policies, procedures and work processesRequired Skills- Excellent read and written Korean- Normal spoken and written EnglishWillingness to take absolute responsibility for work tasksAbility to prioritize tasks and work effectively under pressureAbility to work both independently and as part of a teamSelf motivated even when attending to routine tasksInnovative and analytical towards processes and working environmentAbility to follow company best practicesCareer Development And TrainingNew starter trainings about the Company, professionalism, domain knowledge, MOW will be provided.The Financial and Risk Business of Thomson Reuters is now Refinitiv. Refinitiv equips the financial community with access to an open platform that uncovers opportunity and catalyzes change. With a dynamic combination of data, insights, technology, and news from Reuters, our customers can access solutions for every challenge, including a breadth of applications, tools, and contentall supported by human expertise. At Refinitiv, we facilitate the connections that propel people and organizations to find new possibilities to move forward.As a global business, we rely on diversity of culture and thought to deliver on our goals. Therefore we seek talented, qualified employees in all our operations around the worldregardless of race, color, sex/gender, including pregnancy, gender identity and expression, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, disability, age, marital status, citizen status, veteran status, or any other protected classification under country or local law. Refinitiv is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer providing a drug-free workplace.Intrigued by a challenge as large and fascinating as the world itself? Come join us.LocationsBeijing-Beijing-China

Cleaned_Desc: Are you interested in being part of a fast paced technology company with the largest e-commerce platform in the world, and deep diving into the core technologies backing its large scale distributed system? Amazon.com, a Fortune 500 company based in Seattle, Washington, is the global leader in e-commerce. This is a global opportunity where the candidate will have to work with teams in Seattle, Europe, India, and China.The candidate is responsible to develop the core Prime and delivery experiences for international Prime customers. The candidate will own an independent technical domain in Prime ecosystem to build software, innovate solution and raise the bar of customer satisfaction. The candidate will have opportunity to dive deep the world of Prime architecture and directly contribute to Prime to make it even greater.Group Overview:As part of International Technology organization, the team located in Seattle and Beijing are seeking to bring the benefits of Prime to as many customers globally as possible. This team is missioned to execute, envision and evolve the tooling and solutions of Prime expansion by overseeing all the required software and development effort to expand Prime worldwide. We challenge ourselves by automating/self-servicing every part of manual development effort for Prime expansion while we are working intelligently with 10+ global core partner teams to deliver Prime as efficient as possible to every corner in the world with good quality.Key Responsibilities:* Develop large scale, high performance, high reliability system.* Working independently as a domain owner to work with PM, TPMs and other Amazon partners to deliver the domain work required to launch Prime on time with good quality.* Work backward from customer, analyze customer behavior, understand the real customer needs and build and deliver new solution to improve the customer experience.* Work closely with both local and global technical, design and business team to design new systems or refactor existing systems.* Work as the owner of the system and operate excellent to provide stable and robust services to customers and other teams.* Innovate based on new ideas and build comprehensive system/features to improve customer experience.Basic Qualifications* BS or MS degree in Computer Science.* At least 3*-year experience in developing large scale, distributed system* Strong OO design and strong hands-on experiences on system refactoring, decoupling.* Deep experience building software applications in Java, C++ and Perl, preferably in a UNIX/Linux environment.* Fluent English oral/writing skill.Preferred Qualifications* Proven system refactoring experiences.. Proven working experiences as single thread Tech leader to drive multiple partners to deliver project efficiently.

Cleaned_Desc: Job ID 709952BRLocationShanghai, Shanghai Municipality, China (Mainland); , China (Mainland)Business Shanghai Disney ResortDate posted Sep. 29, 2019Job Summary: As a Senior Analyst, Sales Analytics, you will support on sales related analytical works, including attendance and revenue analysis by sales channel and partner, market intelligence and sales opportunity analysis, as well as analysis support for co-op with sales partners in order to achieve goals for Shanghai Disney Resort. You will report to the Senior Manager, Marketing & Sales Analytics, and will be based in Shanghai.Responsibilities:You will Support & evolve sales analytics practices in executing data collection, management, analytics, implementation, and reporting across sales initiatives.Partner with internal stakeholders and leverage data within commercial and CIMA to help build out business intelligence, identify new opportunities, enable decision makingLeverage data visualization tools & techniques to develop KPIs, dashboards, and systems to deliver insights that drive business recommendations, innovative business solutions and enable sales optimization.Perform deep dive analyses and other related duties as assigned or required, e.g. partner co-op performance analysisBasic Qualifications:Bachelor degree in Math, Statistics, Marketing, Social Studies, Psychology or similar majors3- years of experience in data management, market research or analyticsStrong ability to draw conclusions from vast amounts of data.Statistical skills, analytical and interpretation.The ability to work to tight deadlines.Strong Excel skills a MUST.Strong attention to detail a MUST.SQL, SAS and Tableau experience preferred.Analytical and presentation skills.Ability to work in a team-oriented environment in a complex and diverse business unit of a multi-national company.Partnering, relationship-building, and influencing skills. Natural curiosity and desire to learn.Good or Fluent in spoken and written Chinese and English.Additional Information:Keyword: SHDRProfessionalAbout Shanghai Disney Resort:Shanghai Disney Resort, the first Disney resort in Mainland China, is a place where friends and families can escape together to a whole new world of fantasy, imagination, creativity and adventure. The resort is home to the Shanghai Disneyland theme park; two themed hotels; Disneytown, a large shopping, dining and entertainment district; a Broadway-style theatre; Wishing Star Park and other outdoor recreation areas. Shanghai Disney Resort Cast Members provide world-class service to guests, and the resort brings classic Disney stories and characters to life with authentic cultural touches and themes tailored specifically for the people of China. Shanghai Disney Resort offers something for everyone - thrilling adventures, lush gardens where guests can relax together and enriching interactive experiences.About The Walt Disney Company:The Walt Disney Company, together with its subsidiaries and affiliates, is a leading diversified international family entertainment and media enterprise with the following business segments: media networks, parks and resorts, studio entertainment, consumer products and interactive media. From humble beginnings as a cartoon studio in the 1920s to its preeminent name in the entertainment industry today, Disney proudly continues its legacy of creating world-class stories and experiences for every member of the family. Disney's stories, characters and experiences reach consumers and guests from every corner of the globe. With operations in more than 40 countries, our employees and cast members work together to create entertainment experiences that are both universally and locally cherished.This position is with Shanghai International Theme Park Company Limited, which is part of a business segment we call Shanghai Disney Resort.Specific benefits vary between different roles and may be adjusted according to company policy.Shanghai Disney Resort does not charge a fee to submit job applications and has not authorized any individual or company to charge to do so. Please always check our official channels or platforms for the most relevant recruitment information.It is the policy of the Company to provide equal opportunity for all employees and candidates for employment without regard to race, religion, color, sex, family status, sexual orientation, national origin, age, marital status, covered veteran status, intellectual or physical disability, pregnancy, nationality/ethnicity, migrant worker status, carrier of infectious diseases status, or any other category of persons to the extent provided by law. The "Equal Employment Opportunity" in this policy extends, but is not limited, to recruitment and employment, promotion, demotion, transfer, layoff/ termination, rate of pay, and other forms of compensation, education, and training.
